comparison_summary: Week 1 and Week 2 both cover a 7-day period, capturing web analytic data focused on user engagement and interaction with a website. In Week 2, there is a general increase in sessions, pageviews, transactions, and revenue compared to Week 1, along with a notable decrease in bounce rate and an improved conversion rate. These differences suggest heightened user engagement and effectiveness in converting visits into transactions during Week 2, despite slightly fewer average users and new users compared to Week 1.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average Sessions
key_metrics_comparison.description: There was an increase in average sessions from 1,543 in Week 1 to 1,683 in Week 2, indicating a rise of approximately 9% in user sessions.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average Users
key_metrics_comparison.description: The average users per day decreased slightly from 1,265 in Week 1 to 1,238 in Week 2, showing a minor drop of 2.16%.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average New Users
key_metrics_comparison.description: Average new users slightly decreased from 427 in Week 1 to 424 in Week 2, a decrease of approximately 0.74%.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average Pageviews
key_metrics_comparison.description: Average pageviews rose significantly from 6,226 in Week 1 to 6,892 in Week 2, reflecting an increase of about 10.7%.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Pages per Session
key_metrics_comparison.description: Pages per session slightly increased from 4.01 in Week 1 to 4.07 in Week 2, indicating a minor improvement in engagement.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average Session Duration
key_metrics_comparison.description: The average session duration decreased from 163.1 seconds in Week 1 to 153.88 seconds in Week 2, a reduction of 5.64%.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Bounce Rate
key_metrics_comparison.description: The bounce rate improved, decreasing from 20% in Week 1 to 16% in Week 2, indicating better user retention.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Conversion Rate
key_metrics_comparison.description: The conversion rate increased significantly from 2.8% in Week 1 to 4.25% in Week 2, showing enhanced capability to convert visitors.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average Transactions
key_metrics_comparison.description: Average transactions increased from 34 in Week 1 to 49 in Week 2, an increase of 44.7%.

key_metrics_comparison.name: Average Revenue
key_metrics_comparison.description: Average revenue saw a substantial rise from $1,623 in Week 1 to $2,087 in Week 2, marking an increase of about 28.64%.
